website_summaries.verdict: A projector mount that boasts a convenient snap-on/snap-off design for seamless installation.
pros: Crafted from cold-rolled steel that guarantees the mount can serve you well for an extended period of time
Mount's arms can be extended or adjusted any time you choose
Low-profile flush mount will hold a projector approximately 6 inches from a ceiling
Intended for use with projectors up to 30 pounds
cons: Mount is flimsy, tends to shake, and may require frequent adjustments to ensure it stays in place after installation

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Value for $. Wish it was a little easier to lock it down once the projector is leveled. I don't think.i would use it where I could not reach it to tweak the alignment. My ceiling is below a floor with a wide span, so it vibrates a bit, which causes the projector to re align itself. This is NOT so much a mount problem, except that the lock screws slip over time. Tweak.about every 3-4 mos. Would buy again. Mounting an Optoma 4k projector. Screws into 2 rafters and 2 toggle bolts in 5/8" sheetrock
customer_reviews.author: Barkyhill

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optoma UHD51A
customer_reviews.text: The website picture makes this product look quite large. I was concerned that the small hole configuration of the Optoma UHD51A would be too close. This comes with two small and two large brackets attached. Being that there are just 3 holes on the Optoma UHD51A, you need three of the small brackets. You will also need to use spacer "S" because the m4 screws are too long.
customer_reviews.author: fitfestus

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Using it for a JVC DLA RS15U. Barely meets the bolt pattern. It wiggles some on the ceiling, but it is stable for my setup since its already the 2nd floor. I would get it would move if someone was walking above the mount. Some difficulty getting a great grip with wrench to tighten. Was a little tricky connecting the 2 together once the ceiling portion and the projector portions were installed, had to get the angle just right, and holding a 23 lb projector took several tries. Overall, meets the needs, and will likely suffice for most all projectors within the bolt pattern and weight limit.

I have a white projector and white ceiling but bought the black mount. Delivery was quick and on time.
